definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
erhua variant of 走味[zou3 wei4]

sentences.english: And Swipe-to-Reveal feels a little stale.
Coffee goes stale within a couple of weeks so it is best to buy it in small quantities.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡会在几个星期内走味，因此最好少量购买。

sentences.english: The olive is spoken of as the ruination of martini .
sentences.chinese: 有人认为橄榄会使马丁尼酒走味。

sentences.english: Oh how I hate the cramped quarters and dry, stale air on airplanes.
sentences.chinese: 哦我是如此讨厌飞机上拥挤的座位和干燥走味的空气。

definition: to become tainted with the smell of sth else/to pick up an odor
taste/texture (of food)/how food feels in the mouth
refrigeration/cold storage/to keep (food, medicine) in cold environment
erhua variant of 走味[zou3 wei4]
